Aniket's Notes

Laws of thermodynamics

First Law

Conservation of energy ΔQ=ΔU+ΔW\Delta Q = \Delta U + \Delta WΔQ=ΔU+ΔW

Second Law

No process is possible whose sole result is the absorption of heat from a reservoir and the complete conversion of the heat into work.

Zeroth Law

Two systems in thermal equilibrium with a third system separately are in thermal equilibrium with each other.

$C_p-C_v=R$

ΔQ=ΔU+PΔV\Delta Q=\Delta U+P\Delta VΔQ=ΔU+PΔV Cv=[ΔQΔT]v=[ΔUΔT]vC_v=\left[ \frac{\Delta Q}{\Delta T} \right]_v=\left[ \frac{\Delta U}{\Delta T} \right]_vCv​=[ΔTΔQ​]v​=[ΔTΔU​]v​ Cp=[ΔQΔT]p=[ΔUΔT]p+P[ΔVΔT]pC_p=\left[ \frac{\Delta Q}{\Delta T} \right]_p=\left[ \frac{\Delta U}{\Delta T} \right]_p+P\left[ \frac{\Delta V}{\Delta T} \right]_pCp​=[ΔTΔQ​]p​=[ΔTΔU​]p​+P[ΔTΔV​]p​

subscript $p$ and $v$ can be droppped from $\Delta U$ as internal energy of ideal gas only depends on $T$

PV=RT,P[ΔVΔT]p=RPV=RT,\hspace{1cm}P\left[ \frac{\Delta V}{\Delta T} \right]_p=RPV=RT,P[ΔTΔV​]p​=R

Thermodynamic processes

Isothermal process

PV=constantPV=\mathrm{constant}PV=constant W=nRTln⁡V2V1W=nRT\ln{\frac{V_2}{V_1}}W=nRTlnV1​V2​​

Adiabatic process

PVγ=constantPV^{\gamma}=\mathrm{constant}PVγ=constant W=P2V2−P1V11−γ=nR(T1−T2)1−γW=\frac{P_2V_2-P_1V_1}{1-\gamma}=\frac{nR(T_1-T_2)}{1-\gamma}W=1−γP2​V2​−P1​V1​​=1−γnR(T1​−T2​)​

Isochoric process

No word done on or by gas

Isobaric process

W=P(V2−V1)=nR(T2−T1)W=P(V_2-V_1)=nR(T_2-T_1)W=P(V2​−V1​)=nR(T2​−T1​)

Heat Engines

Efficiency of heat engine is defined by η=WQ1=1−Q2Q1\eta = \frac{W}{Q_1}=1-\frac{Q_2}{Q_1}η=Q1​W​=1−Q1​Q2​​ The coefficient of performance of refrigerator is given by

α=Q2W=Q2Q1−Q2\alpha = \frac{Q_2}{W}=\frac{Q_2}{Q_1-Q_2}α=WQ2​​=Q1​−Q2​Q2​​

Carnot Engine
